briefdescription.para: returns true if there exists a segment of a polyline of polylines1 and a segment of a polyline of polylines2 which intersect, and false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: a RandomAccessRange of RandomAccessRange of points. The point type must be from a 3D point from a CGAL Kernel. A polyline is defined as a sequence of points, each pair of contiguous points defines a segment of the polyline. If the first and last points of the polyline are identical, the polyline is closed.
the first range of polylines to check for intersections.
the second range of polylines to check for intersections.

briefdescription.para: returns true if there exists a segment of polyline1 and a segment of polyline2 which intersect, and false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: a RandomAccessRange of points. The point type must be from a 3D point type from CGAL Kernel. A polyline is defined as a sequence of points, each pair of contiguous points defines a segment of the polyline. If the first and last points of the polyline are identical, the polyline is closed.
the first polyline to check for intersections.
the second polyline to check for intersections.

memberdef.argsstring: (const TriangleMesh &tm1, const TriangleMesh &tm2, const NamedParameters1 &np1=parameters::default_values(), const NamedParameters2 &np2=parameters::default_values())
memberdef.name: do_intersect

briefdescription.para: returns true if there exists a face of tm1 and a face of tm2 which intersect, and false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: If do_overlap_test_of_bounded_sides is set to true, the overlap of bounded sides are tested as well. In that case, the meshes must be closed. This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: a model of FaceListGraph
a sequence of Named Parameters for tm1
a sequence of Named Parameters for tm2
the first triangulated surface mesh to check for intersections
the second triangulated surface mesh to check for intersections
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of tm1 (tm2)
Type: a class model of ReadablePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of tm1 (tm2)
Extra: Both vertex point maps must have the same value type
an instance of a geometric traits class
Type: a class model of PMPSelfIntersectionTraits
Default: a CGAL Kernel deduced from the point type, using CGAL::Kernel_traits
Extra: The geometric traits class must be compatible with the vertex point type.
Extra: np1 only
If true, also tests the overlap of the bounded sides of tm1 and tm2. If false, only the intersection of surface triangles is tested.
Type: Boolean

briefdescription.para: returns true if there exists a face of tm and a segment of a polyline of polylines which intersect, and false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: a model of FaceListGraph

a RandomAccessRange of RandomAccessRange of points. The point type of the range must be the same as the value type of the vertex point map. A polyline is defined as a sequence of points, each pair of contiguous points defines a segment of the polyline. If the first and last points of the polyline are identical, the polyline is closed.
a sequence of Named Parameters
the triangulated surface mesh to check for intersections
the range of polylines to check for intersections.
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of tm
Type: a class model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of tm.
an instance of a geometric traits class
Type: a class model of PMPSelfIntersectionTraits
Default: a CGAL Kernel deduced from the point type, using CGAL::Kernel_traits
Extra: The geometric traits class must be compatible with the vertex point type.

briefdescription.para: returns true if there exists a face of tm and a segment of polyline which intersect, and false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: a model of FaceListGraph

a RandomAccessRange of points. The point type of the range must be the same as the value type of the vertex point map. A polyline is defined as a sequence of points, each pair of contiguous points defines a segment of the polyline. If the first and last points of the polyline are identical, the polyline is closed.
a sequence of Named Parameters
the triangulated surface mesh to check for intersections
the polyline to check for intersections.
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of tm
Type: a class model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of tm.

memberdef.argsstring: (const TriangleMeshRange &range, OutputIterator out, const NamedParameters &np, const NamedParametersRange &nps)
memberdef.name: intersecting_meshes

briefdescription.para: detects and reports all the pairs of meshes intersecting in a range of triangulated surface meshes.

detaileddescription.para: A pair of meshes intersecting is put in the output iterator out as a std::pair<std::size_t, std::size_t>, each index referring to the index of the triangle mesh in the input range. If do_overlap_test_of_bounded_sides is true, the overlap of bounded sides are tested as well. In that case, the meshes must be closed. This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: a model of RandomAccessRange of triangulated surface meshes model of FaceListGraph.
an output iterator in which std::pair<std::size_t, std::size_t> can be put.
a sequence of Named Parameters for the algorithm
a range of Named Parameters for the meshes.
the range of triangulated surface meshes to be checked for intersections.
output iterator used to collect pairs of intersecting meshes.
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: an instance of a geometric traits class
Type: a class model of PMPSelfIntersectionTraits
Default: a CGAL Kernel deduced from the point type, using CGAL::Kernel_traits, where Point is the value type of the vertex point map of the meshes
If true, reports also overlap of bounded sides of meshes. If false, only the intersection of surface triangles are tested.
Type: Boolean

parameterdescription.para: an optional range of sequences of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of a mesh tm
Type: a class model of ReadablePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of tm.
Extra: All vertex point maps must have the same value type

memberdef.argsstring: (const FaceRange &face_range, const TriangleMesh &tmesh, FacePairOutputIterator out, const NamedParameters &np=parameters::default_values())
memberdef.name: self_intersections

briefdescription.para: collects intersections between a subset of faces of a triangulated surface mesh.

detaileddescription.para: Two faces are said to intersect if the corresponding triangles intersect and the intersection is neither an edge nor a vertex incident to both faces.
This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag, Parallel_tag, and Parallel_if_available_tag.
a model of ConstRange with value type boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::face_descriptor.
a model of FaceListGraph

a model of OutputIterator holding objects of type std::pair<boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::face_descriptor, boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::face_descriptor>. It does not need to be thread-safe.
a sequence of Named Parameters
the range of faces to check for self-intersection.
the triangulated surface mesh to be checked
output iterator to be filled with all pairs of non-adjacent faces that intersect
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of tmesh
Type: a class model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of tmesh.
an instance of a geometric traits class
Type: a class model of PMPSelfIntersectionTraits
Default: a CGAL Kernel deduced from the point type, using CGAL::Kernel_traits
Extra: The geometric traits class must be compatible with the vertex point type.
the maximum number of self intersections that will be detected and returned by the function.
Type: unsigned int
Default: No limit.
Extra: In parallel mode, the number of returned self-intersections is at least maximum_number (and not exactly that number) as no strong synchronization is put on threads for performance reasons.

briefdescription.para: collects intersections between all the faces of a triangulated surface mesh.

detaileddescription.para: Two faces are said to intersect if the corresponding triangles intersect and the intersection is neither an edge nor a vertex incident to both faces.
This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag, Parallel_tag, and Parallel_if_available_tag.
a model of FaceListGraph

a model of OutputIterator holding objects of type std::pair<boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::face_descriptor, boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::face_descriptor>. It does not need to be thread-safe.
a sequence of Named Parameters
the triangulated surface mesh to be checked

output iterator to be filled with all pairs of non-adjacent faces that intersect. In case tmesh contains some degenerate faces, for each degenerate face f a pair (f,f) will be put in out before any other self intersection between non-degenerate faces. Note that these are the only pairs where degenerate faces will be reported.
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of tmesh
Type: a class model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of tmesh.
an instance of a geometric traits class
Type: a class model of PMPSelfIntersectionTraits
Default: a CGAL Kernel deduced from the point type, using CGAL::Kernel_traits
Extra: The geometric traits class must be compatible with the vertex point type.
the maximum number of self intersections that will be detected and returned by the function.
Type: unsigned int
Default: No limit.
Extra: In parallel mode, the number of returned self-intersections is at least maximum_number (and not exactly that number) as no strong synchronization is put on threads for performance reasons.

briefdescription.para: tests if a set of faces of a triangulated surface mesh self-intersects.

detaileddescription.para: This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag, Parallel_tag, and Parallel_if_available_tag.
a range of face_descriptor
a model of FaceListGraph
a sequence of Named Parameters
the set of faces to test for self-intersection
the triangulated surface mesh to be tested
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of tmesh
Type: a class model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of tmesh.
an instance of a geometric traits class
Type: a class model of PMPSelfIntersectionTraits
Default: a CGAL Kernel deduced from the point type, using CGAL::Kernel_traits
Extra: The geometric traits class must be compatible with the vertex point type.

simplesect.para: true if the faces in face_range self-intersect

briefdescription.para: tests if a triangulated surface mesh self-intersects.

detaileddescription.para: This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag, Parallel_tag, and Parallel_if_available_tag.
a model of FaceListGraph
a sequence of Named Parameters
the triangulated surface mesh to be tested
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of tmesh
Type: a class model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of tmesh.
an instance of a geometric traits class
Type: a class model of PMPSelfIntersectionTraits
Default: a CGAL Kernel deduced from the point type, using CGAL::Kernel_traits
Extra: The geometric traits class must be compatible with the vertex point type.

memberdef.argsstring: (const PointRange &points, const TriangleRange &triangles, TriangleIdPairOutputIterator out, const NamedParameters &np=parameters::default_values())
memberdef.name: triangle_soup_self_intersections

briefdescription.para: collects intersections between all the triangles in a triangle soup.

detaileddescription.para: Two triangles of the soup are said to intersect if the corresponding geometric triangles intersect and the intersection is neither an edge nor a vertex of both triangles (with the same point ids, ignoring the orientation for an edge).
This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag, Parallel_tag, and Parallel_if_available_tag.
a model of the concept RandomAccessContainer whose value type is the point type
a model of the concept RandomAccessContainer whose value type is a model of the concept RandomAccessContainer whose value type is std::size_t
a model of OutputIterator holding objects of type std::pair<std::size_t,std::size_t>
a sequence of Named Parameters
points of the soup of triangles
each element in the range describes a triangle using the indices of the points in points

output iterator to be filled with all pairs of ids of triangles intersecting (the id of a triangle is its position in triangles). In case the triangle soup contains some degenerate triangles, for each degenerate triangle t with id i a pair (i,i) will be put in out before any other self intersection between non-degenerate triangles. Note that these are the only pairs where degenerate triangles will be reported.
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: the maximum number of self intersections that will be detected and returned by the function.
Type: unsigned int
Default: No limit.
Extra: In parallel mode, the number of returned self-intersections is at least maximum_number (and not exactly that number) as no strong synchronization is put on threads for performance reasons.
a property map associating points to the elements of the range points
Type: a model of ReadablePropertyMap whose value type is a point type from a CGAL Kernel.
an instance of a geometric traits class
Type: a class model of PMPSelfIntersectionTraits
Default: a CGAL Kernel deduced from the point type, using CGAL::Kernel_traits
Extra: The geometric traits class must be compatible with the point type of the point map.

briefdescription.para: tests if a triangle soup self-intersects.

detaileddescription.para: A triangle soup self-intersects if at least two triangles of the soup intersect. Two triangles of the soup are said to intersect if the corresponding geometric triangles intersect and the intersection is neither an edge nor a vertex of both triangles (with the same point ids, ignoring the orientation for an edge).
This function depends on the package Intersecting Sequences of dD Iso-oriented Boxes.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag, Parallel_tag, and Parallel_if_available_tag.
a model of the concept RandomAccessContainer whose value type is the point type
a model of the concept RandomAccessContainer whose value type is a model of the concept RandomAccessContainer whose value type is std::size_t
a sequence of Named Parameters
points of the soup of triangles
each element in the range describes a triangle using the indices of the points in points
an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the elements of the range points
Type: a model of ReadablePropertyMap whose value type is a point type from a CGAL Kernel.
an instance of a geometric traits class
Type: a class model of PMPSelfIntersectionTraits
Default: a CGAL Kernel deduced from the point type, using CGAL::Kernel_traits
Extra: The geometric traits class must be compatible with the point type of the point map.

simplesect.para: true if the triangle soup self-intersects, and false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Functions to test if there are self intersections, and to report faces that do intersect.
